context: Moving out of Maya's place into your own studio apartment. Bittersweet independence.

choices.text: Got a place near the harbor. Nothing fancy.
choices.response: Near the docks? That area floods in winter. Did you check the ceiling for water stains?

choices.text: Yeah. It's time I had my own space.
Don't worry. I'll still be at the shop every day.
choices.response: I wasn't worried. I was just... never mind. Good for you.

lines.text: The studio is small. A bed, a kitchenette, a window overlooking the harbor. The ceiling has water stains. She was right.
You set your keys on the counter. Your keys. Your counter. Your door that locks.
It's the smallest place you've ever had. It feels enormous.
